website_summaries.verdict: These 4 reusable K-Cups offer an affordable alternative to name-brand models. However, they come with similar compatibility issues as well as some durability concerns.
pros: A 4-pack of universal K-Cups that fit most 2.0 and 1.0 Keurig coffee brewers
Users rave about the small mesh that prevents grounds from seeping through
cons: Some leakage during brewing has been noted
Compatibility issues for various Keurig machines, such as the K150

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my Keurig 2.0
customer_reviews.text: None of these 4 cups were be recognized in my Keurig 2.0. Did not want to have to hack on my machine to make them work. :(. I contacted the company. They seemed interested only that I write a review, so I hope they are happy and will now stop sending me emails now asking me to review this produce. I ended up putting them in the trash as NONE of the 4 cups I received could be recognized by my Keurig. Obviously not everyone had the same results I did. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, takes a few tries to make a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I received my Delibru 4 Pack Reusable K-Cups and these reusable k-cups have been working just fine. Like some people have mentioned in the comments, the compaction of the ground coffee is the key to making great tasting coffee. If you overfill and over-compact the coffee grounds in the k-cup, the water will not filter through the coffee and will overflow from the top of the k-cup. I typically fill the k-cup 3/4 of the way with loose coffee grinds, tap it on the counter two or three times, and then run it through the machine. These k-cups are very easy to clean, just run it through hot water to clean the cups. I recommend this product to others!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Y.

customer_reviews.title: Wont buy any other kind
customer_reviews.text: These are WORLDS better than the other ones out there. First off, you get 4 and you really don't need 4. These are built with such a fine mesh, that the coffee and the loose tea I put in them don't end up into my cup. Minimal cleaning and maintenance especially compared to the other designs on the market. These are affordable and much easier and CLEANER to work with. I'd recommend these to any keurig owner looking to stop wasting all of the plastic (and $$$) on K-cups and start using their own coffee/tea. Cons: None so far. I'm sure after time the mesh will start to give but that's the case with any reusable K-cup.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Simon

customer_reviews.title: Game changer.
customer_reviews.text: I love finding optimizations in value from the things I consume every day. Coffee is at the top of that list. Buying these resusable K-cups allowed me to do that, kicking wasteful expensive disposable K-Cups to the curb. Now, it's not about short term savings - if you are mindful of how much coffee you use per cup, you can save about 20-30 cents a cup, which amounts potentially to about 50% savings all in all. If you a ton of coffee like I do you'll pay for the cups, disposable filter, and the container to store your coffee beans/grounds after a few months. Highly recommended. Enjoy! Coffee Filters -  Coffee Gator Container -
customer_reviews.author: GDM

customer_reviews.title: Favorite filters
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried so many of these and these are my favorites! These are the easiest to clean, they don’t leak. I don’t have to bang the crap out of them to get the grinds out. I actually just ordered another set so I can pitch my others into the recycling. Doesn’t matter which way they’re turned they go until my machine. No knooks and crannies to get into while washing. Perfect. (And they’re my favorite color)
customer_reviews.author: DIY Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and brews a delicious cup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and brews a delicious cup of your own choice of coffee. We like a half-caffeine cup and do not like the only half-caff option widely available. With these cups we can brew to our taste. Easy to clean-up as well.
customer_reviews.author: M Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Coffee's great
customer_reviews.text: I have not had these long, but so far I have no problem at all with them. Easy to use, clean and the coffee taste great. We get our Coffee from Coffeeam, and it is mostly from Costa Rico, and Guatemala medium blend. We make our coffee in a Bunn 10 cup make in the morning, now the coffee that is made in a Keurig will never be as good tasting as a Bunn, but for a extra morning cup and one in the afternoon these filters in a Keurig can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: rmaddtx

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I can't really say anything about durability because we just got them. What I can say is these work brilliantly! They're easy to clean and use and they make a great cup of coffee. What a pleasant surprise! These work so much better and make a much better cup of coffee than the "My K Cup" that came with our brewer. We love 'em! I've seen comments on the small hinge, but it would appear to me that even if the hinge fatigues it will still work just fine. The shower head cap works great. It's nice to buy a product that works and so easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Gearhead

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I ordered these. I started working at a place with a Keurig and started looking around at how much K cups can cost (a lot) so I started looking for alternatives. The instructions states that there will be a little sediment in the bottom of your cup - not grounds. After drinking most of the coffee I make sure to swirl my cup to mix in the sediment and voila there's nothing left once the cup is empty. I definitely recommend these to anyone looking for k cup replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Burch

customer_reviews.title: Not for a K-Mini
customer_reviews.text: The top needle on my K-Mini (the slim type) actually hits part of the Delibru K-cup's plastic, even after I make absolutely sure it's flush on the K-cup holder. I tried it without the circular-hole-thing on top (you can pop it out) so the needle isn't hitting anything, but the resulting hole is too big which lets out coffee grounds. This is very tight on the K-cup holder also and needs to be pushed in hard.
customer_reviews.author: torx

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable product.
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't found the ideal coffee to use with these cups, but they work very well, clean up easily, and let me use local coffees. I never liked the throw-away aspect of commercial K-cups, and never found a brew I liked. I am very close with these cups, but still experimenting with grind and strength. The key to a good cuppa is to fill and pack these cups well...but leave a bit of headspace. Too fine a grind and you have a bit of grit, too course and you have hot water.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: It does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why it gets 4.5 star on Amazon but this kcup does not work. I tried several times and tried 2nd kcup our of the 4 in the box but either one is working. The coffee has no taste and it looks just like tea. I don’t know how it works for the rest customers and if it is because I did not use it properly, let me know and I will give a try again and re-write my review.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fang

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the DéliBrü, this is my sencond order and I love them.
customer_reviews.text: These are just right, they fit my Keurig 1.0 perfectly. They are recessed on the bottom to accommodate the needle on the Keurig 1.0. In the past I ordered k-cups that said backwards compatible and they are but you have to insert the pod in a very specific orientation or you puncture the bottom screen which will leave coffee grounds in your cup. Usually I'm not that wide awake on that first cup and punctured all four of my new k-cups in the first two weeks I had them. Many of the advertised products do not display or mention this (recessed bottom) and so it's a little confusing. I highly recommend the DéliBrü !
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t make a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in this product. I’ve tried 4 times to get a flavorful cup of coffee but to no avail. I follow the instructions, even tried adding a little more coffee and set my keurig to “stronger” and still cannot get a decent cup. I have an old filter that this company shows as being less effective than theirs, but the other design works better, at least for me. If you like a weak cup of coffee than the DeliBru is for you. Yes it’s easy to use and to clean, but I’m wasting good coffee trying to get a satisfying cup!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Morelli

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't have to research home-made modifications to get these to work correctly
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews I found that, regardless of grind coarseness, these k-cups resulted in water spilling out from the top of the dispenser. Tried several remedies and adjustments - then realized, with so many other options to choose from, I shouldn't have to spend time making home-made fixes to get these to work properly. Do yourself a favor and buy a brand that works as-is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Sprays All Over Does Not Funnel Down in The Cup
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for my KEURIG Coffee Maker. Although it is simple to use and just pops in ontop when I went to make my coffee in the morning the coffee did not flow smoothly in the cup. Instead the coffe sprayed all over and outside the cup and that is because you really need a funnel adapter that the unit goes inside like the original one I purchased years ago which can be found at Bed Bath and Beyond and possibly her at Amazon- so returning it for a refund. Will just have to pay more for the unit made by KEURIG.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Seidel

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these, but unfortunately not the case. Extremely tight fit that caused the cup to bend on bottom. Drips quite a bit after it should be done. Inside of lid is hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Springbear

customer_reviews.title: Weak, watery, disappointing cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Instead of re-writing what other customers have already discovered, read Mark Nelson’s review 2/1/20. After purchasing this product and then reading several critical reviews after a few uses, his explanation made perfect sense for the reason why this product is a fail! Weak, watery coffee and it overflows out from the top of the K-Cup and causes a mess. Returned today. Will try something with a better design. Of note, this is my first Keurig and the Caribou K-Cups I purchased make an AMAZING cup of coffee, so I’m 100% confident the machine has nothing to do with the poor output of this product.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: How can these turn dust into life juice??!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I get these, because I like coffee, have a Keurig and will waste away if I can't have my precious black God juice. I am amazed at these. I put dusty bean stuff in, and freakin' COFFEE comes out! These haven't, in the few months of what seems like usage equaling breathes of air, leaked or been destroyed. Definitely recommend these miracle working little things!
customer_reviews.author: Cipher 79

customer_reviews.title: YES!  They DO work!
customer_reviews.text: A few people have said that these pods do not work in Keurig machines - actually. they work just fine! Once in a while they don't 'seat' quite right and you get an error message - just reposition (usually the hinged side to the back/left) and the message will go away. We've used ours MANY MANY times AND when we do get the 'error message' we are always able to re-seat and use. LOVE THEM!!!! Lets you mix your coffees, etc. DO mind the instructions and don't over-fill... you can get an error message if there is too much pressure against the cap :) These are GREAT! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kengrove

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try with my own coffee at work, which is a very fine ground espresso (Bustelo). I expected that grounds would sift through the screen, but am so pleasantly surprised that it doesn't. While its a bit of a bother to have to prepare and clean a kcup rather than use the prepacked ones provided at my job, it's so worth it. The coffee is superior to what we have offered. Furthermore, it is also much better than the expensive Bustelo K-cups that I also tried.
customer_reviews.author: David Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bummed about the product. I made sure to look to make sure it'd fit my Keurig and I still wasn't able to use these. I got the oops message.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Yankasky

customer_reviews.title: Save money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of coffee but I'm not a coffee snob so the Keurig is awesome. These reusable K Cups are perfect because they come in a 4pk which makes it super convenient to make 4 cups of coffee before you have to clean them. Cleaning is a breeze just dump out the grounds and rinse out the KCups nice and easy. Also, the savings instead of purchasing KCups by themselves are worth it. It's also better for the environment that you don't just toss single-use KCups into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with my Keurig K250
customer_reviews.text: The description states "...our reusable K-Cups are made to work with ANY Keurig brewer, new or old! ". Well they didn't work in my brand new K250 brewer. Tried all four reusable K-cups in various rotations and kept getting the Opps message on the brewer's lcd display informing me of an incompatibly issue. So back to Amazon for a refund they go.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Orlyk

customer_reviews.title: Great! But please make filters!
customer_reviews.text: *edit* The Keurig stopped recognizing it. No idea why. love these but I don't like the clean up! I can never get all of the grounds out and I don't want to clog my drain rinsing even a little bit of coffee grounds down the drain. Please make filters. It would make these a much better option than paying almost $1 per ipod with the pre made kpods.
customer_reviews.author: Kags

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit 2.0 - K250
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit our K250 model keurig (2.0 version). We get the non compatible error and it visibility doesn’t fit. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in your weak cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I started to feel guilty about all the single-use plastic k-cups I was throwing out on a daily basis, so in an effort to be a little more eco-friendly, gave these a shot. They're not terrible, but grounds will filter through into your coffee, and the brew is pretty weak. I even got the little paper filters to try and stop the grounds and slow the drip for more strength, but it's ultimately just not getting the job done for me. I've actually decided to backtrack to the basic 12-cup drip coffee maker, which takes less time to deal with than individually making several reusable k-cups of lackluster coffee for my wife and I each day.
customer_reviews.author: walterman

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these reusable K cups is that you can just plop one into the machine - it doesn't have to go in the machine in a certain direction, like my old one. That said, I also purchased unbleached paper filters, which fit perfectly inside, and prevent sediment. They are fairly easy to clean, just a ring of grounds around the inside if the lid, easy enough to remove with a fingertip. I feel really good about no longer putting a plastic k cup into the trash when I want just one cup of coffee, plus I'm saving money, using my own coffee instead of the crazy price of K cups. That's a win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Trillion

customer_reviews.title: Distant 2nd to store bought (filled) pods
customer_reviews.text: The office sprang for a Keurig machine, and after buying too many landfill-filling pods I decided to be more sustainable with this refillable cup. Unfortunately, it just doesn't brew well. The water goes straight through the mesh and doesn't hold it in the grounds long enough to brew like the solid plastic pods. For me, the filled pods are decent, but still a step down from brewed. This is a watery step lower than that. Feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: mjr

customer_reviews.title: Makes a single cup of my favorite coffee
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was very disappointed with this product. I was excited to brew a single cup of my favorite ground coffee that's not available in k-cups. When I tasted it, it was just black water with lots of sediment. A few weeks later, I purchased the paper filters to put inside this pod from the same brand. I am now pleased with the results as it is sediment free. Tastes as good as or better than ordering from the restaurant. Frustrating that I have to use these paper filters when I expected that I could just use the reusable pod but still less waste than single use plastic pods.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Not for K-Duo Plus
customer_reviews.text: I asked whether it worked in K-Duo Plus and someone answered that it worked like a charm. No, it does not work with K-Duo Plus. It drops into the well but the lid does not go down to snap shut. I dared only to apply a reasonable amount of pressure and gave up. I am now stuck with something that is of no use to me. Too bad. The bottom line: If you intend to use it in a Keurig K-Duo Plus model, don't bother getting it.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Ekin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but makes a slightly weaker cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've had the pink ones with a dolphin on. they work great but were falling apart. Bought this style and although I think the plastic feel solid and good overall quality.. There is just too much mesh.. making my coffee drain too fast and creating a weaker less satisfying cup. They should really cover up most of the mesh in the bottom of the cups.. Updated: Been using these for a while now and I'm adding a star! They make a fine cup of coffee, you just have to use slightly more than the dolphin ones. Also... Use fine ground coffee. Regular grind comes out weak as the grains need more time to soak.
customer_reviews.author: P. Garde

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Keurig and I had ground pumpkin spice coffee grounds and I was trying to figure out how can I make my pumpkin spice coffee with my Keurig and thankfully I came across this! It worked like a charm. Easy to use just pour in the coffee grounds and put it in my Keurig like one of the pods. These are easy to clean by putting them in the dishwasher. You won't notice a difference in taste when using these vs. the pods. These have lasted several washes and still holding up.
customer_reviews.author: April Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Saves a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Quit wasting money on regular k-cups! Get these instead and pick your favorite coffee. Coffee grounds are easily rinsed out of it when you are finished. The coffee is actually better from these than they are K-cups.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sue Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Durable, No Hassles, Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have been using one of these for four months and it has been excellent. This filter cup does not clog, does not get grounds everywhere, the plastic hinge is as good as new, the mesh is not worse for wear or coming apart. The thing doesn't even get coffee stains. Overall, a much higher quality product than I expected. I have been using the same one for months - I still have three more brand new in the box! And the purple color makes it easy for others to tell the difference between this and the disposables and so they do not just chunk it in the trash. My vote of 5.
customer_reviews.author: MarkTX

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Son was given a Keurig machine... but did not want to pay the premium for the prepackaged cups. I ordered these for him... and they work great. They are easy to fill and clean. Coffee is better than I expected from a Keurig.... but I am not reviewing the machine... just the cups, and they work well and have already paid for themselves. The machine is not a 2.0 machine, so I cannot attest to how that works. I am curious, based on what I have seen about the 2.0 machines, how these would work with the machine that is trying to read the lid.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2.0 model perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have the keurig 2.0 these worked greats. It has the recess in the top so the pin don’t poke it it, and the bottom is recessed up as well so it fits in without being poked as well. No issues in the machine brewer perfect. I even shove a tea bag in there after I pull the paper tab off it. Works better than loose ones! So easy to just dump the tea bag and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: DAMAN21

customer_reviews.title: Coffee I like, like I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I can make the coffee to my taste at less than half the price of the factory made disposable cups. I prefer French Market with chicory and if I use the pre-measured cups it costs over seven dollars for twelve. If I buy the 12 oz can I can get about 25 makings for six dollars, or five if I catch it on sale. With my coffee maker I make one large and one small cup which comes out to 16 oz of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The key to a reusable K cup device is the thickness of the closed cover. Too thick and the Keurig won't close properly. That's what I found with other products. The Reusable K Cups for Keurig 2.0 & 1.0 were perfect. The top was thin enough to allow the Keurig cover to close easily. Having four cups to rotate through is good, too. Definitely glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.author: John Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment, and better tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use keurigs very often, usually I use an espresso machine or Chemex. I do like to grind my own beans though, and this allows me to use my own beans. In all, I would say fresh ground beans improve the taste of keurig coffee, for the couple of times I’m in a rush or just want no mess. Of course, the environmental benefits of a re usable feature are huge as well.
customer_reviews.author: Braedon Giblin

customer_reviews.title: Messed up my Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Death wish coffee and wanted to use my Keurig. I bought these since it is cheaper than buying a french press. I used one only out of the pack of 4, and noticed that every time I used it, my Keurig gets messed up with a Clean Needle or doesn't brew a full cup of coffee like it used to! I also don't get a decent flavor thought I full it to the max, so my coffee should taste decently good, but it doesn't and never did! I honestly stopped using them!
customer_reviews.author: Hala

customer_reviews.title: It is a big improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is what I have been looking for. The older model need to be put exactly or else it will give an error message. This basket is deeper and holds more coffee, thus bolder favor. I use the filter paper as well and cleaning is very easy. Now I can enjoy my cup of coffee without guilt by using the disposable K-cup. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: NJNY

customer_reviews.title: No grinds in the cup - awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cups. We’ve had others before and always ended up with coffee grinds in the cup. A friend recommended these. Please pay attention to the bottom when you order - it des matter. The bottom of these cups are perfect for our Keurig - no grinds in the cups. And I feel good about not using a the plastic that comes with regular keyrig cups. Easy to clean and besides saving the earth, it saves you money! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Marina G

customer_reviews.title: If you like weak coffee, this is for you
customer_reviews.text: The coffee comes out very weak with this filter. I am using their filters and finely ground coffee. I pack as much coffee as possible in the cup. The best I have been able to achieve is like diner coffee. I emailed Delibru customer support and asked how to make stronger coffee. She replied with a request for a picture of the problem and my order number. I sent a picture of my cup of weak coffee, and my order number. These are not ideal, I like one cup of strong coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: 1 of the 4 cups was defective
customer_reviews.text: The cups work well in my Keurig and are straight forward. Unfortunately, the quality control was not great as one of the cups is clearly defective. The plastic was not stamped out of the bottom of the cup correctly and the bottom mesh was placed about an inch to the side of where it should have been. This leaves large holes for the coffee grounds to fall through. This leaves me 3 cups, so 3 stars seems fair. Probably would have been a 5 stars had the full set worked properly. I would return them for new ones, but that is a lot of hassle for 1 cup and less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My K Cup 2 is better
customer_reviews.text: Put up next to My K cup 2, this one loses. My K Cup 2 Is better, because it closes and seals and there is room for lid without mushing into the grounds. The flavor is richer with the My K cup 2, which only works in Keurig 2.0. My advice: if you have Keureg 2.0 get the My K Cup 2 linked here:  If you have Keurig 1, then this product could be best, I don’t know.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed to say the least...this got really great reviews and I can’t figure out why. Followed the directions and got the same result several times; grounds leaking through and super weak coffee...really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Keurig 2.0 Hot ( I believe the 450 model) at home and the K145 Office Pro at work and this pod works perfectly in both. I think because the pod is recessed at the bottom it fits beautifully. I have a different pod at home that you have to push down a little harder and it doesn't fit in the Keurig at work at all. I use paper filters but that is just my preference. These are so outstanding. I would recommend them to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones you need if your tired of spending $ on store bought pods.
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be a lot of these out there. I got these and they just work as advertised no issues. I have a Keurig Elite and the only thing I would say is be mindful of the grind. Don't use regular ground coffee. It needs to be ground finer than you think. Open a store-bought pod and you will see the difference. I bought a cheap coffee grinder, bought whole beans and ground them to a fine consistency like the pod. Saves money, trash and the coffee is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Arlington, VA

customer_reviews.title: Very weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this purchase for a couple reasons. First, I could use my favorite coffee flavors without going to the expense of buying KCups. Second, the eco angle was very attractive. The problem is that even when I pack coffee in these things, the coffee is so weak that it's see-through, barely brown, even using the least amount of water. Totally bummed about it. If anyone has any suggestions, I *want* to use these and would be happy to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Davis

customer_reviews.title: Weak Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for months and thought I was doing something wrong such as overfilling or under filling the cups. I've also tried changing how the coarseness of the grind only to have no luck. Turns out I was not and have recently purchased a Keurig brand reusable k cup to see if it was weak as well. Turns out the Kuerig brand k-cup was much much better as far as flavor goes. They are not quite as easy to use or clean but if you'd like to have a good tasting cup of coffee then stick with oem accessories. Hope this review helps future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Liddy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, be careful when cleaning
customer_reviews.text: These are great and give us a way to reduce our footprint. Be careful when cleaning them, especially after some use, as I've had two break within the first few months of using them. On one the screen ripped at the bottom when I was trying to gently get the grinds out of the very bottom (they tend to really stick there), and the second one the lid broke off while I was washing it gently by hand in the sink. Thankfully they send 4 in the one pack so I still have two, but I do wish they were a bit sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fewer space for grounds = weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these cups work in my machine. But they make a terrible cup of coffee. I should have foreseen this, but the cut out in the bottom (that makes it fit in any direction) also cuts out necessary space for more grounds. My default setting is an 8oz cup and the coffee comes out so weak and bland that it's undrinkable. I've tried the 6oz setting and it comes out slightly better, but no where near as tasty as my old reusable k-cups. I'll have to return them. Keurigs already make a questionable cup of coffee (decent but rarely great) and these diminish that quality even further.
customer_reviews.author: StrBellydSneetch

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I feel so much better using these in my keurig everyday! We did buy the paper filters to use with this to keep any small grounds from getting in our coffee and the two together give us delicious ground-free coffee every morning. Easy and quick to wash and I’m not throwing away the plastic k-cups every day.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Kennah

customer_reviews.title: I’m so mad at myself
customer_reviews.text: ...that I didn’t ever gave these a chance. I never believed they would deliver. I felt so negligent all these years throwing out the plastic k-cups that are not able to be recycled (they’re working on it... for how long now?). These reusable k-cups are the beans knees.
customer_reviews.author: idearz

customer_reviews.title: It's a yes for me
customer_reviews.text: I recently indulged in a new Keurig and quickly spent $100 on k-pods! Yikes! That's a nope. So I purchased a reusable k pod at Walmart... Different brand... It was OK but I thought let's get a few more. I read the reviews and decided to try the delibru. Good choice. I just got these an hour ago but I had to try them.out. I made a cup with my favorite French H roast with a paper filter and without. It works just as well without, taste is even better. The mesh is very fine so there was no grounds, sediment, etc. Very happy so far and much better than the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy meissner

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I really hoped these would work well, because the price is great. However, they tend to make a mess in my Keurig - leaking out from the top and sides. I have to clean out the pod-holder part of the machine almost every time I use one of these. They are easy to empty the grounds from afterward. The ECO brand pod works much better - too bad it’s more expensive. Pros - easy to empty after use - less expensive than others Cons - leaks too much during use
customer_reviews.author: Gaia Wild

customer_reviews.title: Holy SH-T.  Perfect and saves a ton of cash
customer_reviews.text: Keurig first kills you with the price of the single cup coffee maker but that isnt enough for them. Then they stick the shiv in deeper by making you pay tons for special coffee that "fits" the maker. I was nervous that this may not fit but it works perfectly. Just don't over-fill nor pack the coffee into it. That is the only advice needed. Pick your coffee (not super-finely ground) and enjoy sticking it to the Keurig "man".
customer_reviews.author: Dark Humor

customer_reviews.title: Works sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes saves money over pre-packaged containers and allows a degree of control over the strength of the coffee. Sometimes the system won't recognize them. The issue isn't with these. it's that Keurig tries to sell over priced coffee. Buy pretty much anything and avoid these machines that try to rip you off. Keurig is junk.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using a single cup Kuering for my coffee. Although I enjoy using it, I HATED all the one use, plastic waste. After a bit of research I found these reusable pods. Problem solved!. Very easy to use, no plastic waste and now I can use the used coffee as compost for my gardenias. I did not know it was going to solve so many problems. You also get to buy a better selection of coffee for less money.
customer_reviews.author: GLENN R

customer_reviews.title: Forget about disposable single serving coffee cups
customer_reviews.text: The amount of plastic being thrown in the trash everyday at the office was really starting to bother me. I couldn't bring myself to continue using individual "throw away" plastic coffee servers. It seems incredibly wasteful and not very environmentally friendly. So I bought these and they work in the Keurig at work with no problem. All I needed in addition to these was some ground coffee and I was good to go. Cleaning them is not a big deal and they are reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great tea contraption
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my tea bags in the keurig. I like to keep the keurig on to have tea very quickly rather than wait for the kettle to boil. This contraption allows me to use over and over with quick rinses. The package comes with a couple of spare and so far only used one
customer_reviews.author: mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Works in new and older coffee k cup style machines
customer_reviews.text: Evidently the first reusable k cup filter I had was for earlier coffee maker models and it caused all kinds of issues when we got a newer model at work. These work in newer and older models and I haven't had a single issue. I will definetly order another package. I have some concerns that the hinge is just a tab of plastic but tge cover does snap in place, so should the hinge snap at some point, I think they will still work. My previous filter had an actual hinge.
customer_reviews.author: helen0225

customer_reviews.title: These are great!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased these. I did give 2 to my boyfriend awhile ago because he liked the idea and he just bought a new Kuerig. We both grind our own coffee and I do like to change up my coffee also. There is no waste to them, unlike the ones you buy at the store that you throw away and they go into the landfill. You will not be disappointed with these!! I usually do not buy things the 2nd time but this was a no brainer!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Rajchel

customer_reviews.title: Helps to save the environment
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are reusable and don't have the waste of regular pods. Easy to use and close tight and easy to rinse off. But these type of pods allow for sediment and occasionally small grounds to leak through. I didn't like the taste or consistency. But I don't think it is this brand's fault, they all seem to do this. I added the disposable paper filters (Capmesso) and now it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: lorirm

customer_reviews.title: Screens Ripped
customer_reviews.text: I bought these reusable K-Cups because of the very good reviews they received, the number of reviews they had and the price was good. I received them on Monday October 5th 2020 and it's now Friday October 9th 2020. Each of the reusable K-Cups have been used no more than four times. One of cups has a ripped screen and the plastic cup itself is cracked down it's length where it's seemed together causing the part of the screen to protrude out. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Do you love weak coffee and wasting time and money? Then buy now!
customer_reviews.text: If weak coffee is your thing, then you’ll love these. No matter what I do, these reusable k-cups just can’t make a decent cup of joe. I’ve tried using the “strong brew” setting, finer ground coffee, and paper filter inserts, but i still just get hot water with a hint of coffee flavor. I was hoping to save some money with these, but ended up just wasting it. The only plus side is that they do “work” with my Keurig 2.0 and haven’t gotten any error messages.
customer_reviews.author: David M Warfel

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea With A Bad Habit of Leaking
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This is a good idea, seeing how popular (and expensive) "K-Cups" cost. You save coffee and money. Cup is easy to clean. CONS: It leaks! I repeat: It leaks coffee! Specifically, the coffee grounds leak into the cup of coffee (which is not terrible). However, it also leaks into the coffee maker. Cleaning it (the coffee maker) is a real pain; especially since it happens every time it is used.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Goer

customer_reviews.title: Great, well made, easy to use and will save money!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I use the disposable filters that go into them just to make cleanup a breeze, but they are great by themselves. I buy speciality coffees to drink when I have time to sit and enjoy a cuppa coffee and these are great! They are sturdy, well made and hold up great! They fit into my coffee maker well and I’m enjoying using them. Saves me money so that I’m not buying the kkups for all my coffee. I use the disposable ones, but I enjoy using these!
customer_reviews.author: MsReadsALot

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: These cups save money on coffee because loose coffee is much cheaper than coffee in the k-cups. Also when you put a liner in these cups it holds the water a little longer and so makes your coffee stronger. You toss the liner with the coffee grounds in it and your cup is practically clean in one swift action.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Look no more!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased and used several different brands and Delibru is by far the BEST! Not flimsy, as some are. Holds the maximum amount of coffee, which was important to my husband. You can use paper cups or not; they are easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: pemcorgi

customer_reviews.title: I’m just not crazy about these.
customer_reviews.text: I guess the price is okay. But honestly, I’m not crazy about them because the two times that I’ve used them, I have this dark, gross layer at the bottom of my coffee cup. Almost like the coffee just passes thru the screens. They feel a little “cheap” and the lid was very hard to open. I purchased them because buying individual k-cups is getting pricy but I will definitely look for others to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley George

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, durable, environment friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have never used kcups with my Keurig because I have been using this reusable cup! It’s so easy to clean, and it does its job. I can’t really give a good comparison since I’ve never used actual kcups before, but I don’t think this reusable cup ruins the flavor or anything. I also make my tea with this as well and it brews my tea so well. I don’t even have to fill tea leaves or ground coffee all the way up to the top edge. You can reduce plastic waste, very environment friendly. I highly recommend !!!
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my k-cups (with side screen only) that caused spillage. These work better, coffee goes down bottom screen so no great pressure forcing coffee out of the side screen. They are easy to insert without adjusting and easier to get used coffee ground out unlike my old ones. I just use my spoon and tap the bottom of upside-down k-cup to get the coffee ground out.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Curnutte

customer_reviews.title: Great, economical kcups!
customer_reviews.text: Great little reusable kcups! I’ve been using these for a few weeks now with no issues. No coffee grinds escaping from them, etc. I like to use various flavored coffees from a local coffee roaster and these make it very convenient to do so in my keurig. I’m getting my mom a set next!
customer_reviews.author: KDiaz

customer_reviews.title: Some grounds sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: These work alright, seem to be just a little large and don't fit perfectly. I am able to use them in the keurig that is at work. They do seem to have some coffee grounds come through the mesh sometimes, mainly with really fine grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with a Mueller coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my elderly mother to use with the Mueller k-cup type coffee maker that I bought for her last year. I'm not really sure why she didn't want to use the individual cups I'd been getting for her (a lot of different varieties so it wasn't that she didn't like one particular brand....) but she asked for something like this so I ordered these. They work great. She is able to use them with no problems and has reported to me that they are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Boone

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: One of the four had a hair in it... Not like loose in the basket, but integrated into the plastic. Pulling it out left a weird groove in the basket, and there's still some hair in there... That one's trash. It's probably a one-off. Some employee that wouldn't wear a hair-net and has already been fired for repeat tardiness. At least that's the story I'm making up. It was just really weird. Otherwise, they're all good. Keurig friendly, without loading up the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: K T Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that works.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact I was able to purchase coffee K Cup filters at a reasonable price. And these filters work with my Keurig coffee maker. Purchased others and found that they were incompatible and caused a mess. No one wants to be waiting in the morning on your cup of Joe! I feel confident to let others know that you will not waste your time and money on other similar products. I have a Keurig Model 55 and works perfectly. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy these and go to Hawaii
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect and save you money, gotta buy them. The pre made cups that usually sell for about 75 cents each rob your $$$$ from you, buy these and make your own coffee mixes and take the extra money you save and fly yourself to Hawaii every year, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: ARTIE STOUT

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, leaves grounds in your coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because the other one we had was letting too many grounds in. This one unfortunately was the same. It makes a think ground like liquid at the bottom of my coffee so I don’t want to even finish my cup. I’m sad because there’s such great coffee not available in k cups.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Reusable K cups for older-model Keurig - excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Although it took me a couple of tries to figure out how best to position these new K cups in my 1.0 coffee maker (I've had since December 2012) once I did, they worked beautifully! They are a breeze to clean up, and - maybe it's just my imagination - but my cuppa Joe seems to taste better; maybe because with more mesh surface they allow for better flow - ? Whatever, I am very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kay West

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: They are excellent for their intended purpose, I am sure since they are thin plastic the lid will eventually break off, I don't have a problem with that, as long as it isn't in the first year of use. If you think they should last forever from the material they are made from, you should buy a more expensive one made from thicker and harder plastic. For the price, they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: oneperson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy category
customer_reviews.text: The wife wanted a kcup machine. Fine! But, after wasting tons of money and box after box of kcup coffee I was not happy. Everything I ordered was too strong and staunch. I ordered these reusable kcups and used MY coffee. Yippie, finally a good cup of coffee and cheaper. Used today as soon as delivered and they work just fine. No problem, no mess. If your indecisive just go for it, they work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Not working for us. :( bummer
customer_reviews.text: Having problems with these baskets in our machine causing water to leak all over. We have two other brands of coffee baskets and have never had a problem with water leaking out of our coffee machine like we do when we use these purple baskets. I am unclear what the issue is with theses baskets as they look just like our other coffee baskets. I even made sure to clean our machine to remove any machine errors. We will be disposing of these coffee baskets as they are causing a big mess and continue to look for something else. Wish our other baskets had a brand listed on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Heidiike

customer_reviews.title: Economic, eco-friendly, tasty brew.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying these aren't as easy to use as actual K-cups. You have to clean them and it adds a little time to the morning routine. HOWEVER, I love using them! It's way more economical and eco-friendlier than K-cups. Not to mention that after I bought these, I started drinking better coffee due to the savings. I highly recommend. One negative beyond the extra work: sometimes I get a little silt in the bottom of my coffee mug. I don't mind it, but I imagine some might.
customer_reviews.author: Dad, the Man.

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Feeling much happier now that we are not slowly destroying the Earth with our morning coffee ritual!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold enough coffee
customer_reviews.text: Like several other reviews mentioned it cannot make a strong cup of coffee. If you go by Delibru's directions you will end up with about 8g of coffee in the reusable KCup. If you pack it down some and fill to the top you will end up with about 10g. Neither is enough for a strong 8oz cup of coffee. The issue is recessed bottom. I would say that about 20% of cup volume that would otherwise have coffee in it is lost.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use with my keurig and it works perfectly. I enjoy being able to get fresh ground coffee instead of the pods. Would definitely recommend and will be purchasing more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Reusable K Cups
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Keurig for over 5 years and my original reusable cups were wearing out, so I purchased these cups. These cups have been working as well as my old ones for over a month. I questioned if the quality at first, but they're working great. I was originally instructed with my original ones to only use 1 tablespoon of coffee in them, and that is true with these too. If you overfill them, the water can't get through the grounds properly.
customer_reviews.author: 53JK

customer_reviews.title: Only half the cups are usable- Update
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 of the 4 cups are usable. Not sure why yet, they don’t seem to match up with the coffee needle no matter how I play with them. They are easy to fill and clean though. Update to the first review. 2 of the cups I had trouble with I was able to use, finally. I have a Hamilton Beach and a Chulux, and with a little twirling around they can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Work great, especially with pod coffee filters!
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly - they easily fit in the Keurig with the ease of not having to worry that you are positioning it a certain way! (I ruined my last one by not putting it into the machine correctly.) What surprised me was that I also started using the pod coffee filters -- and boy, what a surprising difference that makes to the flavor! Highly recommend using these with the filters.
customer_reviews.author: Carla H.

customer_reviews.title: So far not so good. CHANGED MY REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of experimenting and changing coffee strength I find the coffee to be thin. I guess that translates to watery. When you use a K cup you get a coffee aroma in the kitchen, not with these. Want to like but also need to enjoy my morning cup of coffee. Upping my rating after some more experimenting. Added more coffee than suggested. Will come back if any more changes.
customer_reviews.author: Pat & Chuck

customer_reviews.title: I have used these for years.
customer_reviews.text: Always have a great coffee with these. I have 3 boxes and fill all at once. They are ready to go when I need them. I have some of the original ones from years ago. No need to contribute to the plastic ocean or landfill. I just empty outside in the garden or trash can, rinse and dry. No filters needed!
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: pretty happy with these
customer_reviews.text: These are great and much better fo the environment. Sometimes having a paper filter helps but sometimes it causes the water to spill over. I usually end up placing the kcup in my coffee cup to steep the grounds longer because I like the coffee stronger. I don't have to do this with loose tea. Happy with them over-all
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Hallameyer

customer_reviews.title: These did not work - water pouring over the sides ...
customer_reviews.text: These did not work - water pouring over the sides of my Keurig. My Keurig is about 2 years old and I have been using refillable pods for over a year. I tried multiple times to make these work by not putting in as much coffee, changing the placement etc..but i had the same result each time. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as replacements for our Keurig brand k-cups because the lids on the Keurig brand began breaking off over time. I especially enjoy the purple color because it helps distinguish mine from my husband’s black Keurig one. I rinse mine after every use and he usually doesn’t until he’s ready to use it again. Yuck! These are sturdy and feel more heavy duty (aka long lasting). Maybe even a bit more so than the Keurig ones. They fit my Keurig machine with no issues and the lid stays closed. I would buy these again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: LaurenRyszka

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I love this. I was using regular kcups for about a month after receiving a Keurig as a gift. Ordered these in order to for more coffe per kcup, and of course to be a little more cost conscious as well as environmentally friendly. They are great over all.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Torres

customer_reviews.title: Good, but there's a trick to it
customer_reviews.text: The first couple of times I used it, I thought my coffee was too weak. I learned a trick that works with my machine. If I first brew a 4oz cup, then open and close the top and immediately brew another 4 or 6 ounces, this gives me the strength I am used to with the disposable k cups. Clean up is pretty easy. Overall I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but....
customer_reviews.text: There is a more expensive brand that has a different brewing system that I absolutely love... This is simplistic, cheap, and brews straight down. There are pods available that don't drip but disperse the water in different directions into the pod, and force the water to brew from the sides and not the bottom, and have better filtration so the coffee is less gritty.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frog

product_meta.title: Reusable K Cups for Keurig 2.0 & 1.0 4PACK Coffee Makers. Universal Refillable KCups, Keurig filter, Reusable kcup, k cup k-cups reusable filter by Delibru (4 Pack)
feature_bullets: ✅ vast Keurig model compatibility: whether you’re the proud owner of a first generation, Keurig 1.0 brewer, or have one of the latest Keurig 2.0 machines, our reusable K-Cups are made to work with any Keurig brewer, new or old! So even if you have two Keurig's at home, or a different machine at work, our reusable cups will help you enjoy your favorite brews, anywhere you might be! Cups fit anyway you insert it Unlike other designs! And no need to swap out the Keurig filter holder.

✅ finest quality reusable K cups on the market: our cups are made in an ISO 90001 certified factory, using the best quality, 100% BPA free Plastic, which is also 100% Dishwasher safe! Featuring a tight seal, the délibrü reusable K-Cups ensure no leaks or messes, while they ensure even water dispersion, helping produce the best brews you ever had!

✅ Refillable K-Cup - flawless design, Zero hacks!: forget video tutorials, online tips and using inferior reusable cups that require several brewer modifications prior to use! Délibrü’s superior reusable cups are a perfect match for your Keurig, providing you with a Hassle-Free, convenient, fill-and-brew experience!

✅ More dollars in your pocket, less waste: use every one of your favorite blends up to their last scoop and stop buying disposable K-Cups made out of paper or lower quality plastic! Our K-Cups will help you minimize all Keurig brewing accessories expenditures, allowing you to get more out of your blend purchases and your Keurig brewer, all the while helping you remain environmentally conscious, too!. Unlike competition our ridge-less design on the inside makes cleanup a breeze

✅ 100% Money-Back Guarantee: not happy? So are We! In the unlikely event our K-Cups fail to meet or exceed your expectations, you are free to return them within the first 60 days and receive a full refund of your purchases, no questions asked! The best reusable K cups on Amazon - Purchase now!! Ours is the highest rated reusable pods on Amazon.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars8,637 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
